Citation: Smithsonian Institution Archives, Record Unit 7084, SIA_007084_B03_F02
Title: Section of Temple of Tigers, East Wall Gymnasium (Reduce Top)
Transcription or Longer Des:
Section of Temple of Tigers, Showing the unique Entablature Profile.
Facade of upper structure and front face of vestibule vault above the middle of the column are restored. The lines should have been uniformly dotted. Facade of lower structure may not have occurred as here indicated, for there is a possibility that other chambers existed to the right of this.

a. Section of Gymnasium wall--dotted area.
b. Hypothetic continuation of stairway.
c. Serpent column and outer chamber or vestibule.
d. Sanctuary, entered by pilastered doorway with three wooden lintels.
e. Lower Temple, with sculptured columns and walls
Notes: Temple of Tigers, Section, East Wall Gymnasium

Citation: Smithsonian Institution Archives, Record Unit 7084, SIA_007084_B03_F02
Title: Section of Nunnery or Palace
Transcription or Longer Des: Showing earilest portion with superstructures and additions at the right and left

Citation: Smithsonian Institution Archives, Record Unit 7084, SIA_007084_B03_F02
Title: Plan of Nunnery or Palace
Transcription or Longer Des: Indicating probable stages of growth. The black represents the nucleus, the gray the first addition, the white the second addition. d and e are annexes.

Citation: Smithsonian Institution Archives, Record Unit 7084, SIA_007084_B03_F02
Title: Plan of Temple of Tigers, Gymnasium Group
Transcription or Longer Des:
a. South end of gymnasium wall.
b. Hypothetic position of stairway.
c. Columns and Vestibule of upper temple.
d. Sanctuary; walls, covered with paintings.
e. Lower tentple, with square columns and sculptur between.
Notes: Plan of Temple of Tigers, Gymnasium Group (INK)

Title: Castillo, Three Views
Transcription or Longer Des:
Castillo
South face massive large feature hole over door 3 apole ____ beam
The ___ has 92 steps 11 in rise 10 in surface and is divided other surfaces ___ to ___ & c The Castillo is square and rises in two main walls and two commences ____ to the top 939 ft)
Side of door always same standing figure in relief full space
[The word "hieroglyphs" in lintel above entrance. ]
Notes:
Castillo
[[First Drawing in center of page of a rectangular structure on top of a large structure that wider at the bottom than at the top - perhaps resembling a pyramid with a flat top]]

[[Third drawing profile of building perhaps showing roof slope]]

Cap really decorated with creative [[ ]] symbols and figures. columns elegantly cover with graceful feathers and serpent heads & laels suphellif(?) have broken in all cases feathers

The Castillo
Jan 18th 95
